lead: This week in tech highlights significant innovations and developments, including AI advancements, startup activities, and notable product launches.

stories.title: AI Goals for 2026: What Every Organisation Should Prioritise
stories.summary: As organizations enter 2026, AI is evolving from isolated pilot projects to integral components of strategic planning. This shift emphasizes the need for businesses to prioritize AI integration across various functions, ensuring they leverage its full potential to enhance efficiency and innovation.

stories.title: VicWater backs more gov data-sharing to boost AI
stories.summary: VicWater is advocating for increased government data-sharing to enhance AI applications within the Intelligent Water Networks program. This initiative aims to leverage data for better decision-making and operational efficiency in water management.

stories.title: Apple’s online store now lets you build a new Mac exactly the way you want
stories.summary: Apple has revamped its online store, allowing customers to customize their Mac purchases down to individual specifications. This update enhances user experience by providing more options for hardware configurations, indicating Apple's commitment to personalization in its product offerings.

stories.title: SpaceX seeks FCC nod for solar-powered satellite data centres
stories.summary: SpaceX is pursuing approval from the FCC to establish solar-powered satellite data centers aimed at supporting AI workloads. This initiative reflects a growing trend towards sustainable technology solutions in the tech industry.

stories.title: Nissan's A/NZ finance arm embarks on $35m digital transformation
stories.summary: Nissan's finance division in Australia and New Zealand is launching a $35 million digital transformation project, which includes replacing core systems and implementing AI technologies. This move aims to enhance operational efficiency and customer service.

stories.title: Google Brings Genie 3's Interactive World-Building Prototype to AI Ultra Subscribers
stories.summary: Google has introduced Genie 3, a prototype that allows users to create interactive, video game-like worlds using simple text prompts. This innovative tool showcases the potential of AI in creative applications and user-generated content.

stories.title: Apple Leadership Is Quietly Getting AI-Pilled, Report Claims
stories.summary: Reports suggest that Apple’s leadership is increasingly focusing on AI integration within their products and services. This strategic pivot may indicate a forthcoming major push into AI-driven innovations as the tech giant seeks to remain competitive.

stories.title: AIエージェント時代の脅威モデル入門──「自律性」が増やす攻撃面をどう捉えるか
stories.summary: This article discusses the evolving threat models associated with AI agents, highlighting their increased autonomy and the potential security risks they pose. It emphasizes the need for robust security measures to mitigate these risks as AI technology advances.

stories.title: Apex Legends won't be playable on Nintendo Switch after its next season
stories.summary: Respawn Entertainment has announced that Apex Legends will cease to be playable on the original Nintendo Switch after Season 29, transitioning to the upcoming Switch 2. This decision reflects the game's evolution and the need for more powerful hardware to support future updates.
